citation.article-title: Analysis of 16S rRNA and methane monooxygenase gene sequences reveals a novel group of thermotolerant and thermophilic methanotrophs, Methylocaldum gen. nov.

p.s: Description of Methylocaldum tepidum sp. nov.
The characteristics are the same as the characteristics given in the genus description above, but include the following traits.
Pleomorphism may occur in stationary growth phase.
Chain formation may occur in late exponential phase of growth.
Non-diffusible brown pigments are produced to differing extents in later stages of growth (light to dark brown).
One-week-old colonies are buff and butyrous or cartilaginous.
Upon prolonged growth, colonies turn light brown.
Temperature range of growth is 30–47° C.
The type strain is LK6, which has been deposited in the NCIMB.
